section.para: The ngx_http_access_module module allows to limit access to certain client IP addresses.
Access can also be limited by password. Simultaneous limitation of access by address and by password is controlled by the directive.

section.name: Example Configuration
section.para: The rules are checked in sequence until the first match is found. In this example, an access is allowed only for IPv4 networks 10.1.1.0/16 and 192.168.1.0/24 excluding the address 192.168.1.1, and for IPv6 network 2001:0db8::/32. In case of a lot of rules, the use of the ngx_http_geo_module module variables is preferable.

directive.name: allow
directive.para: Allows access for the specified network or address.

directive.name: deny
directive.para: Denies access for the specified network or address.
